page.title: 10HOUSING IN THE GRIN'TON AREA
page.content: The area is of Outstanding Natural Beauty and consequently is an attrac- tive place to live,for local employ- ees,as well as residents commuting to nearby towns.There are controls on new building and restrictions on changes from agricultural to domestic use.Dwellings range mainly from 2 to 4 bedroom types,mainly privately owned with only a small and reducing %age under Council ownership.Older cottages would have accommodated families dependant on farming and servicing the communities.The textile industry subsequently influenced the residential development between the wars.Estates of modern detached and semi-detached houses have been devel- oped in W.Bradford and Chatburn.Older property is invariably brought to modern standards.Often larger property is used as accom.for the elderly.
